🍔🍔🍔 PERFECT BURGER

In-n-out or homemade??? 

I love in-n-out being 5 minutes away from my house and it tastes great, but nothing compares to Homemade brioche buns + farm grown tomatoes & lettuce + California sweet onions + Cheddar + grass-fed beef and a little bit of homemade mayo. 
#burger #hamburger #cheeseburger #homemadeburger #homemadehamburger #grilledbeef #grilledburger #classicburger #americanstyle #fodie #losangelesfood #losangelesphotographer #foodphotography #foodreel #asmrcooking

CHEESE STUFFED PUMPKIN FLOWERS
Unbelievably delicious summer dish
All you need:
- 20 pumpkin (zucchini) flowers 
- 200g (1/2lb) ricotta cheese 
- 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese 
- 1egg
- 1tsp of capers
- 10 black olives chopped 
- 1/2cup of cured salmon cut in cubes 
- 1tbsp of dill chopped (optional)

How to:
Gently wash and clean the flowers. Set aside. 
Mix all other ingredients. Stuff the flowers with the mixture. Twist to close each flower on top. Put them on a baking tray covered with baking paper. Sprinkle with some more parmesan cheese and olive oil. Bake at 180C (350F) for about 10-15 minutes. If cheese doesn’t get crispy on top, broil for a minute to get nice crisp and color. 
#videorecipe #videoricetta #fioridizucca #pumpkin #pumpkinflowers #veggies #stuffedvegetables #foodreels #foodblog #cheese #bakedcheese #parmesan #ricotta #salmon

Pasta alle Cozze e Vongole
My absolutely favorite pasta of all times. And the best thing - it’s so easy to make. 
This pasta is perfect for a hot summer day, but also good in colder seasons. You can never go wrong with it, weather it’s a quick lunch just for yourself or a formal dinner with friends and family. It tastes delicious and looks so sophisticated. 

For the sauce:
- 1lb mussels 
- 1lb clams
- a handful of cherry tomatoes cut in halves 
- garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper 
- parsley chopped 

Cooking:
Clean clams and mussels with a brush and cook them on high in a covered pan for about 5 minutes, until they open up. Throw in trash all unopened shells, they were dead before cooking. Drain through a cheesecloth and save the juice that shells released in the pan. Leave the desired quantity of clams and mussels in their shells for decor, clean the rest. 
Start cooking spaghetti. In a deep pan sauté garlic in olive oil, add tomatoes, salt, pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes, add the juice and all the clams and mussels and stir them together. Add some pasta water and spaghetti al dente to the sauce. Mic everything together and let it cook on low for a minute. Add parsley, sprinkle with some raw olive oil and serve. 

For pasta I used:
- 300g of 00 flour 
- 3 eggs
- 1/2tsp of salt
- 1 tsp of olive oil

#pasta #homemadepasta #freshpasta #pastamaking #spaghetti #cozzeevongole #clams #mussles #seafoodpasta #foodblogger #easyrecipes #reelrecipe #pastafresca #pastaalluovo #eggpasta #losangelesfood

YELLOW PEACH GALETTE 🍑 

I love spending our summer evenings on the backyard with a cup of chamomile tea and something fruity and sweet, like a fruit galette. 

This one was supposed to be peach only. But, well, things went wrong. The dough was resting in the fridge and I was about to cut fruit, when I discovered that my kids ate almost all the peaches. So had to get creative add something else. Luckily my sons left some strawberries and blueberries, so I mixed fruit and berries together. Even though I really was craving peach flavor, my galette turned out delicious. 

For the pastry:
220g plain white flour
110g cold unsalted butter
1/2 tsp salt
2 tbsp sugar
Approx 3 tbsp cold water

Filling:
Fruit, berries and 2 tbsp of sugar
#galette #tart #fruittart #peachpie #bakind #easyrecipes

COURGETTE AND CHEESE TART

If you want to make an impression, here is the recipe to save and make this summer (см. комментарии для рецепта по-русски)

We got invited to a friend’s house for dinner and I needed something easy, but gourmet and gorgeous looking. As I’ve been all into summer pies lately, it wasn’t hard to decide. 

I was looking for a crunchy base, soft creamy filling and nice looking baked seasonal vegetables on top. 

I’ve never made anything similar so it was a total hit or miss. Especially with this spiral summer squash design, I had no idea how it will look or taste. 

So for the crust I decided to go with a simple and kind of basic recipe:
Pastry
110g unsalted butter, cold and grated 
220g of all-purpose flour
1 tsp salt
1/4 tsp black pepper
About 4 tbsp of ice cold water (I put an ice cube to keep it cold)
Mix all ingredients till the start coming together, make a ball, wrap in plastic and let it rest in fridge for about 1/2 hour. Roll in between two baking paper sheets, place in a dish and bake at 190c (380F) for about 30 minutes. 

After the crust was ready, I spread the filling on pie base and started assembling sliced zucchini on top of it. It took some time, but not crazy much. I sprinkled the pie with a pinch of black pepper, to give the aubergines some flavor.

Bake at 200C (400F) for 15 minutes. I prefer to eat zucchini al dente, so this is just the right time for them. At the end I did broil the pie for a couple minutes to get some nice color on top. If you want your aubergines softer, leave the pie baking for a little longer
#pie #vegetablepie #zucchini #zucchine #courgette #courgettepie #cheesepie #spiral #veggietart #tart #кабачки #цуккини #easycooking

🍑PEACH CHEESECAKE 

For me the most two summer flavors and scents are peach and watermelon. And as the summer is slowly coming to an end I try to enjoy them almost daily. 
A fresh cut whole watermelon appears on my countertop closer to noon and by 4pm it’s completely gone. And my fruit basket is always full of peaches so the kids can grab as much as they want. So I need to refill it every couple of days. While I am not a big fan of any watermelon recipes, I simply like it as it is, peaches are the whole different story. I love them raw and cooked, in salads, dressings, as garnish and toppings, grilled, fried, frozen and baked. By September we all get a nice peach overload and happily wait for new peaches to come next season. So here is there recipe for one of my favorite peach pies. 

Dough:
220g flour 
110g butter grated 
Pinch of salt 
2tbsp of sugar 
1 egg
1tbsp of cold water 

The easiest pastry to make: mix all together and let it rest for half an hour.

Filling:
1/2 pack of Philadelphia cheese
100ml of heavy cream
2 eggs

Mix all together and pour over the dough 

2 peaches cut in big chunks. 

Bake at 180C (375F) for 35-45 minutes 
#cheesecake #peachcheesecake #peachpie #peachtart #peachgalette #easyrecipes #summerrecipes #philadelphia #smeg #smegappliances #dessert

Floral pancakes 
I totally fell in love with the idea of decorating regular summer zucchini pancakes with flowers. For this gorgeous look you can use either zucchini, courgette, squash or pumpkin flowers. Just clean them right (you can watch how in my “how to” highlights) and put on top of a pancake while frying, before flipping. Just use  your favorite zucchini pancakes recipe and add this cute decor. My regular courgette pancakes recipe is this one

Ingredients:
- 1 courgette or zucchini 
- 1 egg
- 30g Parmesan 
- 1-2 tbsp flour 
- salt and pepper 
Mix all together and fry on med low on a little bit of olive oil 
#courgette #zucchini #zucchinipancakes #zucchinicake #squashrecipes #zucchinirecipes #pancakes #pancakelover #pumpkinflowers #fioridizucca #frittatina #кабачки #foodart

Salad for breakfast? Why not. It’s simple and nutritious to give you enough energy till lunch. 
Ingredients:
- juicy arugula 
- figs sliced 
- blue cheese crumbled 
- salt and pepper 
- olive oil
- honey drizzle 
If you need some carbs, simply add a piece of ciabatta toast. 
I think some lemon juice or balsamic vinegar would work here great too, I just don’t like sour in the morning. 
#figs #figrecipes #fichi #fruitsalad #saladrecipe #breakfastideas #losangelesfoodblogger

Mozzarella and chives Flatbread

Everyone in your family gotta love this easy and delicious flatbread. 
It can be made with either some parsley or chives, green onions or cheese. Or you can mix and add it all together. In my recipe I mixed what was already in my fridge - Mozzarella and chives. 
Here is the recipe:
200g of flour (1.5 cups)
125ml warm water (1/2 cup)
1/2tsp salt
Olive oil 
Cheese shredded 
Chives chopped 

Combine flour, water and salt. Mix the dough. It should be soft and not sticky. Add some more flour if it keeps sticking to tour hands. Let it rest for half an hour. Divide in 4 equal pieces. Roll each piece pretty thin, sprinkle it with olive oil and your filling.  Form a tight roll like I show in the video. Then swirl it and roll with a rolling pin again. 
Fry on a dry pan for 2-3 minutes on each side. Brush with some butter. You can also add some vegetable oil to give tour flatbread a golden look. It truly one of the best pita breads I’ve ever made. I always double the recipe for my family. 

Очень вкусные и простые лепешки, которые стоит попробовать:
200г муки
125 мл теплой воды
1/2 ч.л соли
Оливковое масло
Сыр, зеленый лук
Замесите тесто из муки, воды и соли. Оставьте на 30 минут. Разделите на 4 части. Каждую раскатайте довольно тонко, смажьте маслом и посыпьте луком и сыром. Сверните в тугой рулет, а затем в улитку. Улитку снова раскатайте. Выпекайте в сковороде по 2-3 минуты с каждой стороны, пока не зарумянится. Можно выпекать на масле, а можно и без. В любом случае, лепешки обалденные. Будете пробовать?
#breadmaking #flatbread #pita #pitabread #flatbreads #лепешки #лепешкиссыром #луковыелепешки #foodaddict #foodblogger #orangecounty #ocfoodblogger #ocfood #newportbeach #irvine #californiafoodie #irvineblogger

ORANGE SEASON starts with the best ever Carrot cake

Ingredients for the dough
dry:
1 1/2cups (350g) of flour
1 cup (200g) of light brown sugar

a pinch of cloves
a pinch of munmeg

1 orange zest

wet:

TOMATO GALETTE 🍅

A perfect recipe to try before gorgeous summer tomatoes are gone

Pastry
110g unsalted butter grated or cut into small chunks
220g flour
1 tsp salt
1/4 tsp black pepper
About 4 tbsp of cold water

Mix it all together with your hands, don’t over knead.  Form a ball, flatten it using your palm, wrap in plastic and leave in fridge for half an hour. 

This galette can easily go with no filling or you can use literally any soft or hard cheese, cream cheese to make it even more flavorful. I used a blend of Philadelphia, soft goat cheese from Costco and ricotta. 

Roll the dough between 2 sheets of parchment paper. Remove the upper sheet and spread the cheese over your dough leaving 1-2 inches along the edge. Make a thick layer of sliced tomatoes over the cheese. It’s perfect if you use tomatoes of different colors and sizes. Close the edge like I doin the video and give it an egg wash. 
Bake at 375F (180C) for about 40 minutes or until the edge looks golden nice. Serve hot or cold. It’s delicious anyway. 
#galette #fallrecipes #whatsfordinner #foodstagram #foodblogger #pizza #easyrecipes

AUTUMN SPECIAL 🍁🍁🍁
Pumpkin soup in a pumpkin is an absolute fall classic, and is super easy to make. 
There are several ways to make this soup. For the first in season I chose probably the easiest one, when soup and baked pumpkin are made separately. This recipe is perfect when you want your pumpkin soup stand out on the table no matter what, simply because this way it’s very hard to mess things up. 

First you need to bake the pumpkin your soup will be served in. Get the cutest pumpkin, gently cut the upper cap and remove guts. Season it with some salt and olive oil. Place the pumpkin and the cap on a parchment sheet and let it bake at 375-400 F (180-200 C) for about an hour or until your pumpkin feels soft enough
For the soup cut in cubes 3-4 cups of butternut pumpkin
Cut in cubes 2 pears
Sauté pumpkin and pears in dutch oven for 15 minutes or until ready. Add your favorite spices. I added cloves, ginger, nutmeg, salt and pepper.  To a blender add cooked pumpkin and pears, 1-2 cups of chicken broth and 1 cup of half and half. Blend until smooth. Transfer your soup into the baked pumpkin. Decorate with crumbled blue cheese and thyme. Serve hot. 
#fallrecipes #pumpkinsoup #pumpkinspice #pumpkinideas #foodreels #fallinspo

I love potato chips and chocolate bars. And would have them as a snack for 365 days a year… well, but only if they were healthy.
This Sunday morning my son was having his basketball games and around noon I was already pretty hungry. The gym cafeteria unfortunately could only offer some super junk options. So by the time we got home I was starving, but still had to prepare lunch. So I was looking to make a quick snack before lunch was ready. I had a container of roasted peppers stored in fridge and some rye bread in freezer. It took me literally 1 minute to put bread in toaster, season peppers with slat, olive oil and some cilantro (parsley or oregano would work also great) and assemble this easy sandwich. 
I love to keep some roasted peppers in my fridge. It’s not only great for such a sandwich, but also as a main ingredient for a salad, omelette, pasta sauce or as a separate side dish for meat or fish. 
Roasted peppers are so easy to prepare and can be stored in a glass container for up to a week in the fridge. 
How to prepare roasted peppers:
Wash pepper and put on a baking tray covered with parchment paper. 
Roast at 375F (180C) for 40 minutes. 
Put hot pepper in airtight container and let it sweat for 10 minutes. This will help you to peel hard skin easily. 
After the peppers cool down, peel them and remove seeds. Cut in 1/2inch strips. Now it’s ready to be added to recipes, stored in fridge or served as a delicious side. Try it. 
#roasted #roastedpeppers #pepperoni #healthysnack #snack #vegan

I could probably get adventurous and try some new way to prepare this fish. But I just love it simply fried. Thornyhead is one of my favorite from fish market. It’s tender, sweet and not fishy at all. The best part is that it literally takes 10 minutes to make this delicious meal. Just flour, salt and frying in olive oil for 3-5 minutes on each side. Serve with any veggies or salad. It’s a real jewel between my dishes. 
#thornyhead #rockfish #cod #fish #friedfish #easyrecipes #foodartblog

Thanksgiving Dinner Idea 🍁🍂🍁

Subscribe for more @kindelhome 

I swear, this is the most rich of flavor Pumpkin soup I’ve made this season so far. It’s all baked, healthy and delicious.

On one side of a baking tray put:
- 1 butternut squash cut in half
- 1 regular or 3 small bell peppers
- 1 onion cut is half
- 1 big carrot (I had 3 small)
- 1 garlic cut in half
- a bunch of rosemary
- Sprinkle with olive oil, coriander, ginger, cloves, salt and pepper
On the other side place 3-5 small sugar white pumpkins. Cut and clean from seeds, like you see in the video

Roast at 375F (180C) for 30 minutes. If the squash looks undercooked (not enough soft if poked with a knife or fork) put it back in the oven for 5-15 more minutes.

Remove all skin or seeds that are not edible from the roasted veggies, put them in a pan and puree with a blender, adding some chicken or veggie broth. I used about half a cup. Put more salt if needed.

Serve this rich of flavor and fully delicious pumpkin vegetable soup in small white pumpkins. Sprinkle to your tase with some sharp cheese (I used soft goat cheese), roasted pumpkin seeds and basil leaves . 

This recipe if good for either oven or air fryer. I used air fryer on roasting mode and had to roast soup veggies and white pumpkins separately, because of the tray size. But I guess it’s much more convenient to put everything on one big tray and bake it in a regular oven
#pumpkinsoup #pumpkin #thanksgivingdinner #thanksgiving #soupseason #veggiesoup #veggies #smallpumpkin #inpumpkin

November in the kitchen 🍂🍁🍎
Follow @kindelhome for more ideas

Easy version:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry (vegan or regular)
- 2 apples sliced 
- qb honey, cinnamon and brown sugar
- 1 egg yolk for egg wash 

Easy as 1-2-3. Roll the pastry sheet. Cover it (except for the edges) with a thin layer of honey. Put apples on top and some cinnamon and brown sugar on top of the apples. Give the edges a light egg wash, bake at 400F (200C) for 15-20 minutes. Decorate with cranberries. 

Advanced version:
Replace honey layer with easy frangipane (almond cream):
- 3tbsp (40g) butter 
- 1/4 cup (50g) sugar
- 1/2 cup of almond flour 
- 1 1/2 tbsp (10g) of all purpose flour 
- 1/2 egg (2quail eggs)
- 1tsp of almond extract for a very strong almond taste (optional) 
Put all ingredients together and whisk until well combined. Spread onto the pastry sheet, leaving 1/2in edges

This recipe takes literally 5-10 minutes to make. But the outcome is so good
#puffpastry #applepie #appletart #fallrecipe #easybaking #applepastry #americancuisine #americankitchen

CURRY BEEF 🥩 stewed in a Pumpkin 

FOLLOW FOR MORE FALL RECIPES @kindelhome 

This recipe will perfectly work with any kind of meat or chicken.
Ingredients:
1 midsize pumpkin
1 beef cut in cubes
1 onion chopped 
1 carrot shredded 
1tbsp tomato paste 
1 cup water 
1-2tsp hot curry powder 
Dill or parsley 

Cut the top and clean the pumpkin from the inside. Set aside. Sear the meat in a pan and put aside In the same pan sauté onion and carrots for 3-5 minutes. Add tomato paste, curry powder, salt, water and meat. Mix well together and fill other into the pumpkin. Cover the pumpkin lid and put it in the oven  at 375F (200C) for 1.5-2 hours, until the meat is fully cooked. 
#stew #curry #beefcurry #comfortfood #fallrecipes

Lost summer 🌼 recipe to enjoy on this cold November day

Floral pasta is truly a work of art, but remember: only use edible flowers! 🌸🌼 
Flowers are perfect for wider pasta shapes and, of course, any kind of ravioli. It’s so easy and entertaining to create stunning floral patterns in dishes!

Imagine the burst of colors and flavors that edible flowers can bring to your pasta creations! Get inspired by nature’s beauty and elevate your dishes to a whole new level. Join me in embracing the artistry of floral pasta! 
Thank you @malaiasmicrogreens for these beautiful flowers 
#PastaArt #FlowerPower  #FloralPasta #EdibleArt 🍝✨ #freshpasta #pastamaking

🌿 Authentic Pesto Alla Genovese🌿
Save this classic Italian recipe
Follow @kindelhome for more 

Ingredients:
- 2 cups (50g) fresh basil leaves
- 2tbsp (10g) pine nuts
- 1 clove garlic
- 1/4 cup (35g) grated Parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
- pinch of salt 

Instructions:
1. Prepare Basil:Wash and dry the basil leaves thoroughly.
2. Toast Pine Nuts: Lightly toast the pine nuts in a pan over medium heat until golden (careful not to burn them).
3. Blend Ingredients: In a food processor, combine basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan. Pulse until finely chopped.
4. Add Olive Oil: While the food processor is running, slowly pour in the olive oil until the mixture becomes a smooth paste.
5. Season: Add salt and to taste. 
6. Serve: Toss with your favorite pasta, spread on sandwiches, or use as a flavorful dip. #pesto #pestopasta #homemadefoods

Hungry?
Follow @kindelhome for more 

A recipe that’ll leave you licking your fingers. I usually can’t even get it to the table—everyone devours it right off the tray.

It’s incredibly tasty and simple. Make sure to give it a try! 

Ingredients:
Puff pastry 
Pesto
Tomatoes 
Mozarella
Egg

Take a sheet of puff pastry, cut along the edges, give it an egg wash and put it in a preheated oven at 180C (375F) for 10-12 minutes. 
Thinly slice tomatoes and mozzarella. 
Spread pesto on the golden crust. Layer tomatoes and cheese beautifully on top. Sprinkle with pine nuts (optional) and grill in the oven on high for 5-7 minutes. 

You can find the recipe of homemade pesto in my previous reel I posted last week. It’s even better when pesto is not store bought 
Drizzle with balsamic glaze, garnish with basil leaves
#puffpastry #savorypie #caprese #mozarella #homebaking

Christmas countdown. Day 1 
Are you ready  to enjoy the holiday season?
Let’s make every day of December special together. Save and try my easy Christmas Countdown recipes.
French Toast Christmas tree. Easy and so fun to make
Ingredients:
French bread 3 slices 
1/4 cup of milk 
1 egg
1tsp sugar 
Cinnamon (optional)
Avocado oil for frying 
Fruit, berries and powdered sugar for decorating. 
Mix sugar, milk and an egg together. Soak bread for 5 seconds, fry on medium-low till golden on each side. 
Cut bread in halves and assemble the tree. Be hard on decorating
#christmasrecipes #christmastree #frenchtoast #frenchtoastrecipe #ediblechristmastree

Christmas Countdown. Day 2
Dinner rolls wreath
 Sweet dough recipe:
- 300ml of warm milk
- 100g of sugar
- 2/3tsp salt
- 2 eggs
- 2tsp dry yeast
- 500-600g of flour
- 1tbsp oil
- 30g of butter

Mix all ingredients together except for butter with a dough hook for 5-7 minutes. Add softened butter and mix for 5 more minutes. Let the dough proof covered for 1 hour. Form the rolls, assemble them in a wreath and let it proof for 40 more minuets. Give it an egg wash and bake at 400F (200C) for 15-20 minutes until golden brown. season with crushed nuts and decorate with herbs. 
#dinnerrolls #christmaswreath #rolls #recipeideas

Lazy Parmigiana 
Ingredients:
2 eggplants
Olive oil
Tomato purée 
Mozzarella Cheese 
Oregano 
Salt

Cut eggplants in halves and roast on a baking sheet at 375F (180C) for 30 minutes.
In a pan sauté tomato purée with some salt until thickened 
Smash eggplants with a fork, spread a layer of tomato sauce, add sliced mozzarella, cover with another layer of tomato sauce. Broil on high for 5-10 minutes
#eggplantrecipes #melanzane #stuffedeggplant #roastedeggplant

Save the recipe for weekend breakfast 

it’s classic, it’s delicious and it’s easy. Nutella Crepes. Homemade and ready in about 20 minutes.

Ingredients:
2 cups (500 ml) milk
1 cup (250 ml)  water
3 eggs
2 cups (400g)  flour
2tbsp (30 ml) vegetable oil
4tsp sugar
pinch of salt
1tsp vanilla extract

Nutella for filling
Berries for decorating

Instructions:
This amount of ingredients usually makes 15-18 crepes, depends on the size of your pan. You can easily reduce amounts by half. And you can either use 1 or 2 eggs in this case, depends on your taste.
Set flour aside and mix the rest of the ingredients in a blender for 20-30 seconds. Add flour and mix for about a minute more.
Originally crepes dough should rest for 1 hour. But I never have this time in the morning. So I start cooking right away. But if you got time, just leave it on the counter and then give it another blend for 5 seconds right before cooking.
For the pans you can use whatever you’ve got. The main rule is to heat them really well. I mean very well. And reduce the heat to med or med-low. Once you start cooking, you will get it right. Crepes should’t burn, cook all through and get this nice golden color.
Everybody has their own technique for how to pour the batter. I lift the pan, add some dough, just really a little of it and start turning the pan to make sure the batter covers it completely, but with a very thin layer. The crepe is ready to be flipped once it easily stacks from the pan. It usually takes a lot shorter for the second side.
Once your crepes are ready, you can either spread nutella yourself and serve the ready dish. Or just give everyone at the table the option to eat it with either nutella, maple syrup, honey or butter #crêpe #nutella #breakfastideas

Enoki Rolls
Follow @kindelhome for more

Ingredients:
Enoki mushrooms 
Thinly sliced beef (shaby style)

Sauce:
2 tbsp Sesame oil 
2tsp Sesame seeds 
1tsp soy sauce 
1tsp sugar
1/2tsp chilly oil or chilly spice

Soak enoki in salty water for half an hour. Assemble rolls. Fry on mid high on all sides to sear the meat. Add the sauce and simmer for 10 minutes. 
#rolls #mushroomrolls #mushrooms #enoki #enokimushroom #japanesefood #easysnack #foodideas #beef #shabu

My Christmas Pavlova
Third try to post this video
Instructions:
meringue
6 egg whites room temp
375 grams powdered sugar
1 tbsp corn starch
Beat the eggs till first peaks start to form. Add sugar and beat till hard peaks, add corn starch and beat to combine.
On a parchment paper form any shape Pavlova. Bake at 130C for the first 5 minutes, then lower the temperature to 120C and bake for about an hour.
Leave in the oven to completely cool down. Fill with cream and berries. Serve right away.
filling
500 ml (1qt) whipping cream
3 tbsp sugar
250g (1/2lb) mascarpone cheese
Berries, mint and rosemary for decorating
